artist: Artist: Wenceslaus Hollar; Artist: After a follower of Hans Holbein the Younger
creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: man in priestly clothing on stairs in middle ground addresses a small group of figures in foreground, including Jesus, who is held between several men at LL; three figures on R with staffs; one of the figures at R is pointing down to a collection of objects including a skull, a candle, and a helmet at lower center
inscription:
Inscription

inscribed in plate: [And heere hee\'s brought to Pilates house, to bee / Examm\'d, when Roomes Treasurie you see / The Monstrance, Pix, Bulls, Bells and bookes bee there, / And a fat Friers (forc\'d) his crosse doth beare,]

numbered in plate at lower right: [6]
provenance: John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: Christ before Pilate, From the Satirical Passion
